page.title: 19Rutherford Square, Kelso
page.content: {Rutherford Square}is an old folks' sheltered housing scheme which opened in{1981.}It is situated between{ {Horsemarket and Woodmarket}beside the Police Station.{44}people live there and many more come for meals and company. It is a very big place. The walls are painted a very distinctive brown and cream colour. You can smell the cleanliness as you walk in and the doors are orange. In the{Day care {Centre}they have chairs and tables. Outside they have big round plant tubs. The old folk arrive at{9.00 am and leave at{4.00 pm.}They play games as well as talking about the{"good old {days."}Rutherford Square is a{ {wonderful local amenity for Kelso old {folk.}They think that they are treated very well and are lucky to have such a place in which to live and meet.
